Column Comment.0: LINE IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for a line that describes the spatial extent of alinear object such as a seismic line, pipeline, road etc.
Column Comment.1: POINT SEQ NO: Unique identifier for the points of the line, ordered spatially.
Column Comment.2: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.3: BEND INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating that this point represents a bend in the lineexceeding a tolerance defined by the implementation (such as 10 degrees).
Column Comment.4: DEPTH: The depth of this point where the point is located below the ground or sealevel.
Column Comment.6: EFFECTIVE DATE: The date that the data in this row first came into effect.
Column Comment.7: ELEVATION: The elevation of this point.
Column Comment.9: EXPIRY DATE: The date that the data in this row was no longer active or in effect.
Column Comment.10: FIRST POINT INDICATOR: a Y/N flag indicating that the point is the first point on theline.
Column Comment.11: LAST POINT INDICATOR: a Y/N flag indicating that the point is the last point on theline.
Column Comment.12: LATITUDE: Latitude of the point on the line
Column Comment.13: LOCATION QUALITY: Indicates the quality or degree of reliablity of a location.
Column Comment.14: LONGITUDE: Longitude of the point on the line
Column Comment.15: POINT LABEL: The label to be associated with this point for reporting or mapping.
Column Comment.16: POINT NUMBER: A numeric value assigned to a point, such as point numbersassigned for geophysical processing.
Column Comment.17: NODE POSITION: The position of a point, often the position of a node in a well bore,or some other node in a system. For example: surface point, bottomhole point,kick-off point, ....
Column Comment.18: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.19: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.20: SOURCE: The individual, company, agency, application or other source designatedas the source of information for this row.
Column Comment.21: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.22: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.23: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.24: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.25: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.26: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.27: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
